comments:
Customer dynamically creates a RAD (Eclipse 3.02) Workspace and then runs a headless Ant task including projectSetImport to populate the Workspace. Gets the following exception. Note the "Caused by: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Workbench has not been created yet." towards the end.
 
It's not clear why org.eclipse.team.cvs.ui is starting in a headless Ant context...

Any suggestions appreciated.

[projectSetImport] ProjectSetImport: providerId=org.eclipse.team.cvs.core.cvsnature 
[projectSetImport] ProjectSetImport: projectReferences.length=3 
[projectSetImport] ProjectSetImport: msg=ProjectSetImport: projectSetSerializer==null for ProjectSet providerId=org.eclipse.team.cvs.core.cvsnature in projectSetFileName=C:\DOCUME~1\JDAHLG~1\LOCALS~1\Temp\KRYTEN_TEST_BUILD_ROOT\KrytenTestProduct_V0_0_0_183\AntCommon/../KrytenTestProduct/projectSet.psf

I'm marking this as invalid since the Platform does not provide the Ant task in question. I belive that the ant task to perform a project set import is part of RAD so you'll need to contact the provider of the ant task to find out if it works with CVS and, if so, how things need to be configured.

As a point of interest, there was a known issue in 3.0 where the CVS project set importer required the UI to be loaded and this was fixed in 3.1. I suspect that the same ant task used in 3.1 would work (although I don't have access to it to try it so I can't mark the bug worksforme).
Hi Michael, I've searched bugzilla a number of ways for a defect on the 3.0 project set Importer requiring UI components. Was there one opened? Would you know what the number was?
for the record Michael indicated offline that the bug in question is https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=38048

causedBy.message: Workbench has not been created yet.
